title: faker is 0-4 yet still doing most damage
body: cass is such a bullshit champion

Which means he wasnt even that much behind, he still got his gold, his Items, his Level. 

And a Guy like Faker will own you hard.
He was down quite a lot @10 minutes, but due to the open map he could swap lanes and freefarm there.

Soloing elder dragon? WTF is that? 

The game is broken. They can never get it fully balanced. They continually overnerf and overbuff. They change items and act like that makes a difference to gameplay. I think they just sit in a room and ask themselves "Who do we want to see in pro play and who are we tired of seeing in pro play?" Nerfs and buffs follow and they repeat it next patch.

yea no one should be able to solo elder drag, especially solo it and have full health afterword's, I mean cass has little mana issues even with spamming e every second with high base damage and high ap ratio, overloading champ makes great player seem Godlike

> I mean cass has little mana issues

 That's why her first item is {{item:3070}} 

She's a DPS champion like {{champion:74}} {{champion:268}} {{champion:136}} {{champion:163}}, champions like these usually go stuff like 0/4 since they can't actually finish off someone very easily.

She's also a lategame hypercarry, other hypercarries that have any sort of DPS can solo elder drag.

In addition to all of that though, her abilities have ridiculously low cooldowns making her scarily efficient lategame, being able to spam out 500 damage e's every second with q's doing 250 per second. It's one of the reasons that cass is so fun to play with objective-comps, even if her skillcap is ridiculously high.

Well yeah, she is basically meant to play like an ADC.  She has constant targeted spam and heals off of it.  The only difference between her and an ADC is that she has to land an actual skillshot first.

If an ADC can solo elder (which they can with lifesteal, elder is about it taking a long time, not it doing a lot of damage, hence the different between elder and baron) then Cass should be able to as well.
Elder is not hard at all to solo, it just has a ton of health, so it'll take you some time.
If you CS EXTREMELY well on a control mage, you can do it too.
